trans-unit.source: Copies the specified registry key, along with its values and subkeys, to the specified destination key

seg-source.mrk: Copies the specified registry key, along with its values and subkeys, to the specified destination key

target.mrk: Copies the specified registry key, along with its values and subkeys, to the specified destination key

trans-unit.source: Handle to an open registry key. The key must have been opened with the $KEY_READ access right.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the $KEY_READ access right.

target.mrk: Handle to an open registry key.
The key must have been opened with the $KEY_READ access right.

trans-unit.source: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function, or it can be

seg-source.mrk: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function, or it can be

target.mrk: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function, or it can be

trans-unit.source: one of the predefined registry keys ($HKEY_*).

seg-source.mrk: one of the predefined registry keys ($HKEY_*).

target.mrk: one of the predefined registry keys ($HKEY_*).

trans-unit.source: The name of the key. This key must be a subkey of the key identified by the $hSrcKey parameter.

seg-source.mrk: This key must be a subkey of the key identified by the $hSrcKey parameter.

target.mrk: This key must be a subkey of the key identified by the $hSrcKey parameter.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the destination key. The calling process must have $KEY_CREATE_SUB_KEY access to the key.

seg-source.mrk: The calling process must have $KEY_CREATE_SUB_KEY access to the key.

target.mrk: The calling process must have $KEY_CREATE_SUB_KEY access to the key.

trans-unit.source: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function, or it can be

target.mrk: This handle is returned by the _WinAPI_RegCreateKey() or _WinAPI_RegOpenKey() function, or it can be

trans-unit.source: one of the predefined registry keys ($HKEY_*).

seg-source.mrk: one of the predefined registry keys ($HKEY_*).

target.mrk: one of the predefined registry keys ($HKEY_*).

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

trans-unit.source: This function also copies the security descriptor for the key.

seg-source.mrk: This function also copies the security descriptor for the key.

target.mrk: This function also copies the security descriptor for the key.

trans-unit.source: This function requires Windows Vista or later.
